history.text: Hey there!
Have you seen The Social Network?
no
have you ?
i have not seen it
Yes, it was a 2010 Biographical Drama starring JesseEisenberg as Mark Zuckerberg
Have you ?
i am sorry , did not mean to repeat the same question
How did you like the movie ?
No worries, I enjoyed it very much, I am a big fan of biographical movies about interesting subjects
this one centering around the beginning of facebook
It does sound interesting
especially since facebook has gotten so popular, i would like to know more about the founders etc
yeah it gives you a view from Zuckerbergs college days to his development and some of the personal and legal issues
Its got a 96% grade from Rotten Tomatoes and 95/100 form Metacritic
those are good ratings
Would you consider watching it based upon those ratings?
i like the name of the book The Accidental Billionaires...thats a cool name....grabbed my attention
i would like to read the book and see the movie
that is cool, I'll have to check it out some other time
There was a scene in the movie that was pretty pivotal to the movies development where Mark decided to change the name from Thefacebook.com
i really want to see the movie now
its still early in the developmental days of the site at Harvard, and a girl who is on the site tells him (Mark) to "facebook me"
So the name was originally Thefacebook ?
exactly, and the girl says that line, leading to them dropping the "the"
I am sorry that was just the first hint, it wasn't until they met with Sean Parker who is portrayed by Justin Timberlake in the movie where he says to them "Drop the "the" and just call it "facebook"
Sean Parker is the guy who started Napster
i really like Justin Timberlake. Did he do a good job acting in this movie ?
I think so, he's kind of an antagonist though
There was a big legal battle that is detailed in the movie as well
Oh yea, i have heard of Napster
Do you remember Myspace ? i remember Myspace being the first type of social network in a way before Facebook. Once facebook hit the scene though Myspace was done for..lol
I try to imagine how Mark must have felt just creating this small idea and how incredibly huge and popular it became

I do remember MySpace, glad thats over. And whats interesting about Marks idea is how in the first legal battle
 was between him and some other Harvard students who wanted them to help with coding for their web page which was called "harvard connection"
wanted him to help*
All that being said, do you think you'll check it out?
Mark created something called Facesmash first, right ? And then that created attention and thats how he got involved in the Harvard Connection ? That is what i am gathering from what i read
yeah, facesmash got the attention of the Winklevosses whose idea was Harvard connection
cool
Well I hope you check it out, cheers!
oh yes thank you , i am going to check it out
